snippet: Christopher G. Donovan, a candidate for Congress, made his first public comments about the scandal since the arrest of his campaign finance manager in the case.
abstract: Connecticut House Speaker Christopher G Donovan strongly denies that he had any knowledge of what federal authorities say was a scheme to kill a piece of legislation that would have raised taxes and fees on so-called roll-your-own-cigarette shops; denial is Donovan's first public comment since the arrest of his campaign finance manager Robert Braddock Jr.
lead_paragraph: Christopher G. Donovan, a candidate for Congress, made his first public comments about the scandal since the arrest of his campaign finance manager in the case.

headline.seo: Christopher Donovan, Connecticut House Speaker, Denies Knowledge of Scheme to Kill a Bill
headline.main: Connecticut House Speaker Denies Knowledge of Scheme to Kill a Bill
headline.print_headline: Connecticut House Speaker Denies Knowledge of Scheme to Kill a Bill
